item.title: Names of victims in Conn. school rampage released
item.description: Of 20 children killed in Connecticut school shootings, 8 were boys and 12 were girls. All ages 6 or 7: http://t.co/MQlMzhLE -RJJ
item.content:encoded: Of 20 children killed in Connecticut school shootings, 8 were boys and 12 were girls. All ages 6 or 7: http://t.co/MQlMzhLE -RJJ NEWTOWN, Conn. (AP) — Authorities have released the names of the 26 people gunned down in a rampage at a Connecticut elementary school.All six adults killed at the school were women. Of the 20 children who were shot to death, eight were boys and 12 were girls. All the children were ages 6 or 7.Investigators are trying to learn more about 20-year-old gunman Adam Lanza, who killed himself after the massacre. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: ap.org

item.title: John Kerry to Be Nominated to Be Secretary of State, Sources Say
item.description: John Kerry to Be Nominated to Be Secretary of State, Sources Say http://t.co/IX26l1Fe (via @ABC) #politics
item.content:encoded: John Kerry to Be Nominated to Be Secretary of State, Sources Say http://t.co/IX26l1Fe (via @ABC) #politics Sources tell ABC News that President Obama has decided that he will nominate Sen. John Kerry, D-Mass., to be secretary of state. For a variety of reasons including the finalization of the process, other pending Cabinet decisions, and — more immediately — the national reaction to the tragic shooting at Sandy Hook Elementary School, the news will not be announced in the next few days. Secretary of State Hillary Clinton, who is recovering from an illness and a concussion she suffered upon fainting because of that illness, is set to retire in the next few weeks. – Jake Tapper Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: abcnews.go.com

item.content:encoded: . @RHHerald apologises for "guns for Christmas" ad placed in Sandy Hook coverage (photo attached) http://t.co/oyhey2LH http://t.co/qoQRYqhu In Saturday's Herald, an advertisement for guns was placed on a page near stories and a photograph about the tragic school shooting in Connecticut. item.content:encoded: JUST IN: Gunman opens fire in Alabama Hospital, wounding three http://t.co/uh4m99eO Just a day after the tragic shooting in Newtown, Connecticut that left 20 children and 6 adults dead, another gunman has struck again in an Alabama hospital this morning.A police officer has shot and killed the unnamed suspect accused of wounding another cop and two employees of the St. VIncent hospital in Birmingham.The AL reports: Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: globalgrind.com

item.content:encoded: EXCLUSIVE: Clinton will not testify before Congress on Libya, concussion cited http://t.co/dJLPEZFI Secretary of State Hillary Clinton will not be able to testify next week before House and Senate panels on the Benghazi issue because she sustained a concussion, a top State Department official said Saturday. item.title: 病児保育のNPO法人フローレンス代表 駒崎弘樹のblog: <H2 >選挙に行かない男と、付き合ってはいけない５つの理由 </H2>
item.description: 選挙に行かない男と、付き合ってはいけない５つの理由: 特に２０代女子の皆さんに、おっさんから忠告しよう。選挙に行かない男と付き合ってはならない。もし彼氏が選挙に行かない男だったら、今すぐ別れを考えた方が良い。 http://t.co/Tc2lVNNz
item.content:encoded: 選挙に行かない男と、付き合ってはいけない５つの理由: 特に２０代女子の皆さんに、おっさんから忠告しよう。選挙に行かない男と付き合ってはならない。もし彼氏が選挙に行かない男だったら、今すぐ別れを考えた方が良い。 http://t.co/Tc2lVNNz 「社会を変える」を仕事にしてます。病児保育・待機児童解消・ひとり親支援・働き方革命とパパ業の日々 Link - Trackbacks

item.title: Teacher from Stratford shielded students
item.description: A hero from Friday. http://t.co/SqES3FWS
item.content:encoded: A hero from Friday. http://t.co/SqES3FWS Sources and family members have confirmed that Vicki Soto, a first-grade teacher at Sandy Hook Elementary School, was among 26 people killed in a horrific shooting Friday at the school. Soto, who had taught at the school for five years was described by one of her deeply distraught 10-year-old boy pupils as `really nice and funny', was trying to shield her students and usher them into a closet when she came face-to-face with the gunman, the Daily Telegraph reported. According to a Facebook post being circulated by teachers, Victoria Soto, 27, was a hero. When she became aware there was a gunman in the school, she hid her first-graders in closets and cabinets, then told the shooter they were in the gym., Sources and family members have confirmed that Vicki Soto, a first-grade teacher at Sandy Hook Elementary School, was among 26 people killed in a horrific shooting Friday at the school. Soto, who had taught at the school for five years was described by one of her deeply distraught 10-year-old boy pupils as `really nice and funny', was trying to shield her students and usher them into a closet when she came face-to-face with the gunman, the Daily Telegraph reported. According to a Facebook post being circulated by teachers, Victoria Soto, 27, was a hero. When she became aware there was a gunman in the school, she hid her first-graders in closets and cabinets, then told the shooter they were in the gym. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: newstimes.com

item.title: Police: Gunman wounds 3 at Alabama hospital
item.description: Police: Gunman wounds officer, 2 employees at Alabama hospital before being fatally shot: http://t.co/T6kkGB1i -CJ
item.content:encoded: Police: Gunman wounds officer, 2 employees at Alabama hospital before being fatally shot: http://t.co/T6kkGB1i -CJ BIRMINGHAM, Ala. (AP) — Authorities in Alabama say a man opened fire in a hospital, wounding an officer and two employees before he was fatally shot by police.Birmingham Police Sgt. Johnny Williams says the officer and employees suffered injuries that are not considered life-threatening.Williams says police were called because a man with a gun was walking through St. Vincent's Hospital on Saturday morning. When he was confronted by officers, he started shooting and wounded one of the officers. That's when the second officer shot and killed the man.Detectives are still working to determine why the armed man was in the hospital. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: ap.org

item.content:encoded: CRAZY PEOPLE ARE TOO MUCH!! TRAGIC! Bartlesville High School student arrested in school-shooting plot http://t.co/EAWjCc1T via @tulsaworld BARTLESVILLE — An 18-year-old Bartlesville High School student was arrested early Friday after police uncovered an alleged school-shooting massacre plot. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: tulsaworld.com

item.title: Okla. teen arrested in school shooting plot
item.description: BREAKING: Okla. student, 18, arrested in alleged shooting and bombing plot at Bartlesville high school: http://t.co/dlzVQTC3 -RJJ
item.content:encoded: BREAKING: Okla. student, 18, arrested in alleged shooting and bombing plot at Bartlesville high school: http://t.co/dlzVQTC3 -RJJ BARTLESVILLE, Okla. (AP) — A Bartlesville High School student is in custody on charges he plotted to bomb and shoot students at the campus auditorium on the same day that 28 people were shot and killed at an elementary school in Connecticut.Police arrested 18-year-old Sammie Eaglebear Chavez at about 4:30 a.m. Friday after learning of the alleged plot Thursday.An arrest affidavit says Chavez tried to convince other students to help him lure students into the auditorium, chain the doors shut and start shooting. The Tulsa World reports that authorities say Chavez threatened to kill students who didn't help.The Bartlesville Examiner-Enterprise reports Chavez planned to detonate bombs at the doors as police arrived.The school district says students were never in danger. Chavez is being held on $1 million bond. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: ap.org
